Description: Toy mouse, with body modelled in poorly fired ceramic, decorated with brownish-purple paint. The lower jaw is of wood and is moveable (pivoting around wooden pins through main body). A wooden toggle pin is attached to the lower jaw by a string enabling movement.
Curator's comments: For examples of toys found at Lahun, see R. David in Glimpses of Ancient Egypt. Studies in Honour of H.W. Fairman (1979), 12-15.
